benchmark_details.name: TEG-DB (Textual-Edge Graphs Datasets and Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: TEG-DB is a pioneering initiative offering a diverse collection of benchmark graph datasets with rich textual descriptions on both nodes and edges to enhance graph analysis and provide deeper insights into complex real-world networks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To mitigate the challenges in the existing TAG datasets and foster collaboration in the research community for TEG exploration.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The lack of comprehensive evaluation resources may demand significant computational requirements.

data.source: Nine datasets from various domains covering book recommendation, e-commerce, citation networks, and social networks.
data.annotation: Text attribute preprocessing including filtering, truncation, and selection of relevant textual attributes.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated using standard evaluation processes across varied datasets in the TEG-DB.
methodology.interpretation: Results signify performance in link prediction and node classification tasks, with improvements noted when using rich edge text.
methodology.baseline_results: State-of-the-art models across datasets demonstrated varied performance enhancements in node classification and link prediction.
methodology.validation: Comprehensive analyses conducted using multiple models across diverse datasets.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential significant computational resource demands could limit access for smaller organizations.
